conclusion: To determine the speed of the elevator at t = 60 seconds, we need to analyze the acceleration and velocity-time graph provided.
The graph shows the acceleration a as a function of time t. The graph is a series of horizontal lines, indicating that the acceleration is constant.
The acceleration is constant at a = 2 m/s^2 from t = 55 to t = 60 seconds.
Since the acceleration is constant, the velocity v can be calculated using the formula v = v_0 + at, where v_0 is the initial velocity and a is the acceleration.
At t = 60 seconds, the initial velocity v_0 is 0 (since the elevator starts from rest).
The velocity at t = 60 seconds is calculated as v = 0 + 2 Ã— 60 = 120 m/s.
The speed of the elevator at t = 60 seconds is 120 m/s.
